com.phunware.core
Class PwCoreSession

java.lang.Object
  com.phunware.core.PwCoreSession

public final class PwCoreSession
extends java.lang.Object

This class only manages session; like starting and stopping, registering.

Field Detail

SESSION_TIMER

public static final int SESSION_TIMER
A session is stopped using activityStopSession(Context). After this amount of time (in seconds) then the session will expire.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getInstance

public static PwCoreSession getInstance()
Return an instance of PwCoreSession. This will provide a handle to be able to start and stop sessions.

Returns:
A Core session instance.
See Also:
activityStartSession(android.content.Context), activityStopSession(android.content.Context)

getTestInstance

public static PwCoreSession getTestInstance(int flag)
Return a Test instance of PwCoreSession

Parameters:
flag - flag to run tests
Returns:
a Test instance of PwCoreSession

killTestSession

public static void killTestSession()
This will completely wipe out all session related data as well as keys. If this is called, registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String) must be called again to start a new session. This should only be used for testing purposes.

activityStartSession

public void activityStartSession(android.content.Context context)
Start or persist session. Call this on every Activity onStart() method. If a session doesn't exist then a new session will be created. If a session was recently stopped using activityStopSession(Context) then it can be resumed by calling this method before the session expires.

The passed in Context can be the Application context or the Activity context.

RuntimeException will be thrown if registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String) was not called First in Application.onCreate()

Parameters:
context - The current context. It can be the Application context or the Activity context.
See Also:
SESSION_TIMER

activityStopSession

public void activityStopSession(android.content.Context context)
Stop session. Call this on every Activity onStop() The session will be stopped but it can be resumed by calling activityStartSession(Context) before the session expires.

The passed in Context can be the Application context or the Activity context.

RuntimeException will be thrown if registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String) was not called First in Application.onCreate()

Parameters:
context - The current context. It can be the Application context or the Activity context.
See Also:
SESSION_TIMER

pauseCheck

public boolean pauseCheck(android.content.Context context,
                          long currentTime,
                          int expiration)
For Testing: Check to see if this is a potential pause

Parameters:
context - Context to work with
currentTime - Current time in milliseconds
expiration - expiration time
Returns:
true if this could be a pause, false if not.

getSessionId

public java.lang.String getSessionId(android.content.Context context)
Get the current session id. If there is no active session then null is returned.

Parameters:
context - Non null context to work with.
Returns:
Session id, or null if none is active.

isFreshInstall

public boolean isFreshInstall()
Check if the app has started from a fresh installation or not.

Returns:
true if the app is on a fresh install, false if not.

isSessionStarted

public boolean isSessionStarted()
Check if the session has been started or not.

Returns:
True if the session is started and running, false if not started or paused.

installModules

public void installModules(com.phunware.core.CoreModule... modules)
Install MaaS Modules here. It must be called before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession, including registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String). This must be called in Application.onCreate() and should only be called once. Example usage

PwCoreSession.installModules(PwAlertsModule.getInstance(), ...);

Parameters:
modules - New instance of a CoreModule

registerKeys

public final void registerKeys(android.content.Context context)
This should be called after installModules(CoreModule...) but before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession. This must be called in Application.onCreate(). This performs initializations and setup that is required by other method calls.

Use this in place of registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String) if you choose to set the keys in the manifest.

i.e.
<meta-data android:name="META_DATA_APPLICATION_ID" android:value="APPLICATION_ID_HERE" />
<meta-data android:name="META_DATA_ACCESS_KEY" android:value="ACCESS_KEY_HERE" />
<meta-data android:name="META_DATA_SIGNATURE_KEY" android:value="SIGNATURE_KEY_HERE" />
<meta-data android:name="META_DATA_ENCRYPTION_KEY" android:value="ENCRYPTION_KEY_HERE" />

Parameters:
context - Application context

registerKeys

public final void registerKeys(android.content.Context context,
                               java.lang.String applicationId,
                               java.lang.String accessKey,
                               java.lang.String signatureKey,
                               java.lang.String encryptionKey)
This should be called after installModules(CoreModule...) but before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession. This must be called in Application.onCreate() if not using registerKeys(Context). This performs initializations and setup that is required by other method calls.

Parameters:
context - Application context
applicationId - You can find your application key in MaaS Portal
accessKey - A unique key that identifies the client making the request. You can find your access key in MaaS Portal.
signatureKey - A unique key that is used to sign requests. The signature is used to both check request authorization, as well as data integrity. You can find your signature key in MaaS Portal.
encryptionKey - The key used to encrypt and decrypt data that is exchanged between the client and the server. You can find your encryption key in MaaS Portal.

getEnvironmentString

public java.lang.String getEnvironmentString()
Debugging helper. Get an informational string based on currently installed modules.

Returns:
Debug string
